The collaboration involves American and West African surgeons working together in Senegal to incorporate contemporary surgical techniques and improve the facilities in which these services are provided.

In 2004, Dr. Ruenes established ASSISTS (America-Senegal Surgical Initiative, Surgeons Teaching Surgeons), a non-profit organization dedicated to providing African surgeons training and support, in order to eliminate suffering from medical conditions endemic to West Africa.

Recently, Doylestown Health held a special dinner to commemorate the clinical partnership of Doylestown Health Urologist Dr. Albert Ruenes, his esteemed physician colleagues, and guests from Dakar, Senegal.
